choices.text: The standard gauge for railways is a system of tracks that has been used since the mid-19th century to ensure that trains run smoothly and efficiently over long distances. The gauge, which is also known as the "standard" or "main" gauge, is based on the width of the track, with 762 millimeters (30 inches) being the standard distance between the two tracks. This gauge allows for comfortable travel for passengers and provides a stable ride for trains, making it an ideal choice for many countries around the world.
